page_analysis.text_content:
Primary daylight plane (rear)


Fig 23 Side elevation showing Rear primary daylight plane


                                                               7.5' max.      5' min.      7.5' max.
                                                               each           separation   each
                                                               protrusion*                 protrusion*


Note: There is no
front daylight plane.

24' max. for protrusions                                                                                                                              60°

                                                                                                                                    16'             24' max. for protrusions

                                                                                                                                                    Max. bldg. height*


* Max building. height is:                                     * Cumulative length of protrusions must
  • 30' for structures w/roof slope < 12:12                      not exceed 15' on any one side.
  • 33' for structures w/roof slope > 12:12
  • 17' for structures on substandard or flag lots                 Rear protrusions subject to same rules
    regardless of flood plane                                    as side protrusions
  • variable for structures located in flood zones
    except on substandard and flag lots - up to 33'
                                                                                                        Setback line                                Rear lot line
                                                                                                                                    Rear yard

                                                                                                                                    Notes:
                                                                                                                                    • Side daylight plane is
                                                                                                                                      measured (up) at lot line.
                                                                                                                                    • Rear daylight plane is
                                                                                                                                      measured (up) at rear
                                                                                                                                      setback.


28

visual_elements.description: A side elevation diagram (Fig 23) of a two-story house illustrating the 'Rear primary daylight plane'. The diagram shows the house profile with a porch and two dormers on a foundation above ground level. It is annotated with various zoning measurements and lines. A vertical dashed line labeled 'Setback line' and a thick vertical line labeled 'Rear lot line' define the 'Rear yard'. A dashed line, representing the daylight plane, starts at a height of 16' at the setback line and angles upwards and away from the house at 60°. Other labels indicate '24' max. for protrusions', 'Max. bldg. height', and rules for protrusions from the roof dormers: '7.5' max. each protrusion' with a '5' min. separation'. Asterisks on the diagram link to corresponding notes below.

technical_specifications.parameter: Daylight plane starting height at setback
Maximum building height for structures with roof slope < 12:12
Maximum building height for structures with roof slope > 12:12
Maximum building height for structures on substandard or flag lots
Maximum building height for structures in flood zones (except substandard/flag lots)

subheadings: Fig 23 Side elevation showing Rear primary daylight plane
* Cumulative length of protrusions must not exceed 15' on any one side.
sections: Bullet points for Max building height (bottom left)
Note for Cumulative protrusion length (bottom middle)
Bullet points for general Notes (bottom right)

additional_notes: The page number '28' is located in the bottom-left corner.
Asterisks (*) are used as visual cues to link specific parts of the diagram to their corresponding textual explanations.
The image is a clean, high-quality scan from a technical manual with no handwritten annotations, stamps, or significant degradation.
cross_references: The note 'There is no front daylight plane' implies the existence of rules or discussions about a front daylight plane elsewhere.
The note 'Rear protrusions subject to same rules as side protrusions' explicitly references a separate set of rules for 'side protrusions'.
The note 'Side daylight plane is measured (up) at lot line' refers to a 'Side daylight plane', which would be detailed in another section.

The document mentions specific rules for 'structures on substandard or flag lots' and 'structures located in flood zones', indicating these terms and their associated regulations are defined elsewhere.
